intro: Cirrhopetalum spathulatum, commonly known as the broad-leafed bellflower, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped blooms. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is native to certain regions of South America. The plant features lanceolate to spatulate leaves and produces showy, violet-blue flowers that attract pollinators. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
